column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Host a Party in an Apartment Without Getting Busted or Thrown Out
#Text=It 's happened to everyone .

#Text=You 've hosted a party , favorite lite beverage in hand , drinking games ‘ round the round table , and some intense music that was carrying to the building over , when suddenly around 3:20 a. m. , a knock at the door by the local “ proud to protect and serve ” asking you to break it up ( and shut it up ) .
#Text=Time to think on a better party-throwing method to head off homelessness .
#Text=Be sure and keep these tips from http://www.apartmenthomeliving.com in mind before you throw another busted party .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Have a plan .
#Text=This may be a bit more difficult than simply calling everyone up at 7 p.m. for a party at 9 , but it 's well worth it .
#Text=Keep down the sound .
#Text=If you keep down the sound , you ’ll keep down the citations .
#Text=Do n't order a lot of delivery food .
#Text=If the apartment building does n't allow parties , it 's a dead giveaway when the pizza man shows up with ten large pizzas if only two people are supposed to be living in your room !
#Text=Have your party at an earlier time .
#Text=Parties from 6pm to 10pm are much less likely to have the cops called than a party from 8pm to 2am .
#Text=Prepare the neighbors .
#Text=Explain to them beforehand of the party , and if appropriate : Invite them !
#Text=Take it outside .
#Text=This may seem counter-intuitive .
#Text=Not necessarily .
#Text=A party by the pool or a grill-out can often remain a tad calmer than a party without all the outdoor distraction .

#Text=Even better-Plan a midnight volleyball or dodgeball game in a park close to the homestead and bring glow sticks…only Bambi and Thumper will be kept awake , and as long as you do n’t have a giant strobe light , you should be fine .
#Text=Extra hint : Stay clear of glass bottles .
#Text=Most parks do n’t allow them .
#Text=Plan a dinner party .
#Text=Kidding .
#Text=But , it may worth taking the party to a cheap nearby Bar and Grill with live music or a juke box .
#Text=A good group of friends , great food , and a little music always means awesome times .
#Text=And the clincher of the whole thing : NO CLEANUP !
#Text=( Remember to tip your servers . )
#Text=Plan a beginning with the end in mind .
#Text=Mom used to say that nothing good happens after midnight .
#Text=She obviously has never been to a slamming after-party .
#Text=Like tip # 4 , you want to go out on the town , but still want to play host a little at your place .
#Text=Not a problem .

#Text=If you really want to insure that you wo n’t have to lay your head next to Gary , the guy under the bridge , take mom ’s advice a little and invite friends to pre-party instead of an after party .
#Text=Then head out on the town around 11 p.m.
#Text=What this accomplishes ?
#Text=An awesome start to a night out by showing off your digs , and playing host without upsetting the neighbors .
